name: Halibut Cakes (Croquettes)
author: Lori L Dixon
summary: Something delicious to make with leftover halibut or cod or any white fish. My Alaskan family and extended family in the lower 48 love these.
ingredients: 1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 teaspoon seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®)
directions: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Add halibut fillets; season with salt and pepper
Cook until flesh flakes easily with a fork, about 4 minutes per side
Transfer to a plate; cool until easily handled, about 5 minutes
Mix Italian cheese blend, egg, mayonnaise, onion, lemon juice, 2 tablespoons bread crumbs, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, dry mustard, and seafood seasoning together in a large bowl
Pour 3/4 cup bread crumbs into a shallow dish
Shape halibut mixture into 6 cakes and dip both sides in bread crumbs to coat
Heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil in the skillet over medium-high heat
Add halibut cakes and cook until browned, about 5 minutes per side
